body:
I don't know how much space and time it will save, because this series of patches is not finished yet, and not tested.

Aggregations in extensions, which are supposed to be used for indexing rollup, must implement `AggregatorFactory.makeAggregateCombiner()`: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4676/files#diff-90e2d51a725b4d59f09e2f8b740b7f37R70
addressed changes.. also had nulls at last instead of being at first.
Yeah, let's remove those if they don't work out of the box. I guess it's because sigar is optional now.
agree, quick start should work :)
@leventov Addressed comments.
Would anyone review this please?

If I create the HttpClient with `new SslContextFactory()`, I see the following exception:

Creating the SslContextFactory with a trust store path works:
```
        httpClient = new HttpClient(new SslContextFactory("/Users/jw/ssl_test/root.jks"));
```

It's because the current offset being bigger than the next available offset probably means the kafka cluster totally disappeared, or the topic was deleted and re-created, both of which are "abnormal" and so Druid waits for a manual reset before continuing.
This was done in #4115.
See also #4373.
See also #3439.
@kingnj I think these ops are done in parallel now -- have you tried with 0.10.0 and has the situation improved?
Hi @pjain1, I was wondering, are you still working on this? It would still be useful!
And do you think we could/should mark this for 0.11?
Is it working or not? Because when i tried this transformation function over dimensions while ingestion it gives me error that dimension name could not be null it is not accepting dimension name
@SreeHarshaGudise It's just a feature request, so it does not work yet.
Thankyou @gianm  for the reply

So, can u help me up i have a small situation where i have to use timstamp and change it into day of  a week and add it to dimensions .
Thanks in advance @gianm
@leventov could please review again ? Thanks a lot
@gianm Yes I am still working on it. I am done with the code, working on testing it. I think it can go in 0.11
Thank you @pjain1. I marked the milestone as 0.11.0.
Just reviewed the main interfaces, docs, and a little bit of the QueryLifecycle and SQL code. Would like to go back to do a full review after the interfaces stuff is more settled.

Hi @JLLNANA, have you had a chance to read the documents for streaming ingestion using realtime node? http://druid.io/docs/latest/ingestion/stream-pull.html and http://druid.io/docs/latest/configuration/realtime.html will be helpful for you. I guess something is missed in your realtime node configuration.
Apparently when I remove hdfs extension, it works..
@praveev please give sensible names for PRs, and link to the PR being fixed in the description.

@jon-wei If TLS is enabled then the users need to include an extension that provides a properly configured `SSLContext` object to be used by internal http-client for communication within Druid nodes. You can try including the `simple-client-sslcontext`extension and set appropriate [configs](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4270/files#diff-2ac62993fee64079aa2e42f45dd2311eR11) for it like trust store which contains root certificates that can be used to validate server's certificate.

This was noted in the point 7 of the #4270 PR description. Also noted in the documentation here - https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4270/files#diff-2ac62993fee64079aa2e42f45dd2311eR7

I do have the `simple-client-sslcontext` extension enabled with a configured trust store, I'm able to access task logs from the overlord console and run queries if I send them to a broker directly with TLS only, so I don't think that's the issue I was seeing (i.e., I think this is specific to the router)

Are you able to reproduce what I saw locally?
ok..let me check
Could we switch the API to use lists of nodes instead of individual and have the contract be that the first initialization is actually given the full list?
@leventov, for compatibility, do you mean IndexedInts is NOT part of public API ?
@jon-wei there was indeed a problem, thanks for reporting. I fixed it, please try now. `SslContext` binding for `Router` annotation was missing in the extension.
@nishantmonu51 yes, fixed my message
@jon-wei could you please merge this PR?

@akashdw please give readable titles to PRs in the future, because having "Fix issue #4690" is not helpful in Git history. If there are no better options the title of the PR may simply repeat the title of the issue being fixed.
@leventov 👍
back from vacation. checking again.
@drcrallen thanks for review. Could you please merge this PR?
Just waiting for TravisCI
There have been 3 approvals here, it should be good to go after conflicts are resolved.
Please add a test.

>>Audit done.
Not sure why it behaves differently from druid CI env?
Thank you both for all the help!!

Some new rules (e.g., https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4651, https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4564, ...) have been added to the master branch. Please merge the master branch first and test again.

I have the same problem. Did you manage to solve it?

@jihoonson added
Closing this after #4611. If the problem persists let's open another issue
Closing this after #4611. If the problem persists let's open another issue
Is this problem still present?
Thanks for confirming -- I'll close this as a duplicate of #4638.
@QiuMM can you link this in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/docs/content/development/extensions.md too ?
@niketh is this still an issue that is solved by this PR?

Yes I did, It turned out that default configuration files provided in the distribution were not tuned as per the requirements of my system. So you need to configure your architecture depending upon your machine size.

Could you share the content of jvm.config of your historic node ?

It is the default one
[jvm.zip](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/files/1244609/jvm.zip)
The` travis-ci `check fail, I check the log it was not casused by my commit. Looks strange! I just modified a doc file after all. Can re-run the ` travis-ci`?

@gianm @jon-wei : @pjain1 reminded me that this is broken in 0.10.1 release , however it is not severe enough a issue to require 0.10.1 patching. we should probably note this as a known issue in 0.10.1 release notes and point to this PR.
makes sense ?
@himanshug sounds good, I'll add this to the release notes
@jon-wei sure, thanks

@himanshug strange, 0.10.1 seems to have this PR already:

https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/0.10.1/examples/conf-quickstart/druid/_common/common.runtime.properties

the history doesn't show it however:
https://github.com/druid-io/druid/commits/0.10.1/examples/conf-quickstart/druid/_common/common.runtime.properties
@himanshug @jon-wei This was broken in master build, not in 10.1.
@akashdw thanks, sounds like it was a false alarm  :) .

Differentiating locks by three dimensions (read - write, preemptive - non-preemptive, priority) feels like it could be simplified. It should be possible to merge at least two of them, so leaving just two dimensions, or preferably one dimension.

Also, I suggest to explore "read - restructure (compaction, merge, append) - new data (realtime index,  batch index)" dimension, it might be helpful.

Also, something here might be isomorphic to the tri-level [read-write-update](https://github.com/npgall/concurrent-locks) system.

@leventov thank you for the good comment. 

> Differentiating locks by three dimensions (read - write, preemptive - non-preemptive, priority) feels like it could be simplified. It should be possible to merge at least two of them, so leaving just two dimensions, or preferably one dimension.

I guess you mean merging read/write with preemptive/non-preemptive. The motivation here is compaction tasks should not block the tasks submitted by users. For example, let me suppose there are two tasks, a realtime indexing task and a compaction task which optimizes the segments generated by the realtime task. The realtime task can try to append new data for an interval while the compaction task is running for the same interval because some events might arrive late, and even in such a case, the compaction task should not block the realtime task. Please note that the lock is acquired for an interval, not individual segment. I think preemptible write lock is a simple solution to solve this problem. Please let me know if you have any better idea.

> Also, I suggest to explore "read - restructure (compaction, merge, append) - new data (realtime index, batch index)" dimension, it might be helpful.
Also, something here might be isomorphic to the tri-level read-write-update system.

I think it's a nice idea and closely related to fine-grained locking. Actually, fine-grained locking is a quite large issue to be addressed here. I'll raise a new issue for fine-grained locking if it's worth.
@jihoonson could you please describe types of locks for all current types of tasks + the future compaction tasks, in the proposed dimensions?
@zhangxinyu1 you also need to sign CLA: http://druid.io/community/cla.html but some committer also need to review this patch after that.

@leventov thanks very much! I have signed CLA on CLA page.
@KurtYoung @binlijin Could you please review this patch?

I found parallel combining can make too many dictionaries which encompass two additional overheads, i.e., duplicated dictionary generation at runtime and too large dictionary space. I changed the title to fix this problem.

@drcrallen thanks for checking the PR. note that intention of this PR is to only extract leader election code out of TaskMaster and DruidCoordinator classes, put it behind an interface and retain existing behavior as much as possible.
Curator based implementation is done in a way to retain existing behavior and changed only slightly to fix a bug as mentioned in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4699#discussion_r135026352 .
@drcrallen added docs.

```
Failed tests: 

  DruidCoordinatorBalancerTest.testMoveToEmptyServerBalancer:185
```

@b-slim @drcrallen I realized that we already that the JettyServerModule already had a handle to the hum of open connections. In this PR I take advantage of that variable to have better handling on shutdown https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/4716 . Can you review ?
Hi @zhangxinyu1, can you paste the images before and after this change to better show the differences?

@leventov Hello, this PR is experiencing #4389  even though changes are not related to  testMoveToEmptyServerBalancer and also notice that other PR are experience similar issue.  Is there way to resolve it?

@leventov sure, I added a table for it to the proposal. All types of tasks basically acquire read locks if they need to read segments. And then, they upgrade them to write locks while publishing segments.

Hi @zhangxinyu1, this is because we assume that intervals for batch indexing are usually contiguous and there is no hole in the whole interval. But, you're correct. It is possible and should be able to be run if intervals are not overlapped. This issue will be fixed in #4479.

We has been running this in prod, without indication of regression

In the latest patch, I changed to merge dictionaries generated by underlying SpillingGroupers and let StreamingMergeSortedGroupers use the same merged dictionary without runtime generation.
Here is the benchmark result for using merged dictionary. Another 10% of performance gain.

```
Benchmark                                              (defaultStrategy)  (initialBuckets)  (numProcessingThreads)  (numSegments)  (queryGranularity)  (rowsPerSegment)  (schemaAndQuery)  Mode  Cnt       Score      Error  Units
GroupByBenchmark.queryMultiQueryableIndexWithSpilling                 v2                -1                       8              8                 all            100000           basic.A  avgt   30  272800.159 ± 2655.104  us/op
```
